collection_page.h1:
Industrial automation systems and integration —
Product data representation and exchange —
Part 1:
Overview and fundamental principles
collection_page.p: This part of ISO 10303 provides an overview of ISO 10303.

ISO 10303 provides a representation of &tr-product;&tr-information; along with the necessary mechanisms and definitions to enable &tr-product-data; to be exchanged. The exchange is among different computer systems and environments associated with the complete &tr-product; lifecycle, including &tr-product; design, manufacture, use, maintenance, and final disposition of the &tr-product;.

This part of ISO 10303 defines the basic principles of product information representation and exchange used in ISO 10303. It specifies the characteristics of the various series of parts of ISO 10303 and the relationships among them.
The following are within the scope of this part of ISO 10303:

ul.li: scope statement for ISO 10303 as a whole;
terms and definitions used throughout ISO 10303;

overview of &tr-data; specification methods used in ISO 10303;
NOTE 1&sp3;This includes the EXPRESS &tr-data-specification-language; and graphical presentation of &tr-product-information-models;.

li.p: introduction to the series of parts of ISO 10303:
NOTE 2&sp3;&tr-Application-interpreted-constructs; support the representation of &tr-application;&tr-information; that is shared by more than one &tr-application-protocol;;
NOTE 3&sp3;An &tr-application-protocol; is used to define the scope, context, and &tr-information; requirements of an &tr-application;, and the representation of the &tr-application;&tr-information;.
NOTE 4&sp3;&tr-Abstract-test-suites; are used as a basis for &tr-conformance-testing;.

ul.li: scheme for identification of schemas and other &tr-information; objects defined within parts of ISO 10303.
